Package frc.ballstuff.shooting

Class ArticulatedHood

java.lang.Object
frc.ballstuff.shooting.ArticulatedHood
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISubsystem
public class ArticulatedHood
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISubsystem
Articulated hood refers to the moving top section of Shooter. Theres a lot going on here so maybe check out the settings.

    • getSubsystemName

      public java.lang.String getSubsystemName()
      Description copied from interface: ISubsystem
      Used in ISimpleIssue to provide a user friendly explanation as to why their jank isnt working. This could be static but that doesnt make sense since you should be querying an object anyway.
      Specified by:
      getSubsystemName in interface ISubsystem
      Returns:
      the hardcoded name of the subsystem

    • requiredArticulationForTargetSize

      public double requiredArticulationForTargetSize​(double size, double[][] articulationArray)
      This method is supposed to take in camera size and run some math to determine the optimal hood articulation to fire at that target.
      Parameters:
      size - The percieved size of the target
      articulationArray - the metadata where the array is formatted [len = number of entries][size, articulation]
      Returns:
      the optimal articulation given passed inputs

    • moveToPosFromButtons

      private void moveToPosFromButtons()
      Uses nonstandard mapping and moves the hood based on those inputs

    • moveToPos

      public void moveToPos​(double moveTo, double currentPos)
      Moves the hood to a specified point. If you pass in -1 then the hood remains still. If you pass in -2 then the hood is in manual movement and doesn't move. If you pass in -3 then the hood is out of bounds and doesn't move.
      Parameters:
      moveTo - where to move the hood to
      currentPos - where the hood is now

    • moveToPos

      public void moveToPos​(HoodSpecialAction specialAction, double percentSpeed)
      There are some special things that the hood can do, such as manual aiming, not moving at all, and being out of bounds. This overloaded function allows these things to work nicely.
      Parameters:
      specialAction - The special action to perform
      percentSpeed - The speed the motor should run at

    • moveToPos

      public void moveToPos​(HoodSpecialAction specialAction)
      There are some special things that the hood can do, such as manual aiming, not moving at all, and being out of bounds. This overloaded function allows these things to work nicely.
      Parameters:
      specialAction - The special action to perform
